decks.notes: The main concept of this Modern UrzaTron control deck revolves around assembling the Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. By using cards like Sylvan Scrying, Ancient Stirrings, and Expedition Map to search for these lands, the deck can quickly cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the game. Additionally, cards like Oblivion Stone and All Is Dust help maintain board control, while Wurmcoil Engine and Walking Ballista provide additional threats to win the game.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering key spells and removing threats with cards like Path to Exile and Detention Sphere. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and tempo advantage. The win condition is typically through a combination of card advantage, Celestial Colonnade beatdowns, and controlling the board until the opponent runs out of resources. The deck aims to outvalue its opponent and win through incremental advantages.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Noble Hierarch, Knight of the Reliquary, and Reflector Mage to pressure opponents early on. It also includes disruption with Spell Queller and removal with Path to Exile. The deck aims to control the board while steadily increasing its own power with cards like Gavony Township and Retreat to Coralhelm. By playing a mix of creature threats and non-creature spells like Collected Company, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate vast amounts of mana. It uses cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to find these lands quickly. The deck plays powerful colorless threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Karn Liberated to control the board and win the game. It also includes board wipes like Oblivion Stone and versatile cards like Ancient Stirrings to find the necessary pieces. Overall, the deck aims to control the game by utilizing its mana advantage and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with low-cost artifacts and using cards like Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating to pump up creatures and deal damage efficiently. Steel Overseer provides additional support by adding counters to all artifact creatures, while Galvanic Blast can be used as removal or a direct damage spell. The combination of cheap creatures and powerful artifacts allows the deck to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy that aims to finish the game quickly.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by countering spells with cards like Remand and Spell Snare, while also locking down the opponent's mana base with Blood Moon. The deck aims to take control of the game with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique. Card draw and selection are also key components, with cards like Serum Visions and Opt helping to dig for answers. Overall, the deck is focused on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan until it can secure the win.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies with taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Using cards like Chalice of the Void and Ixalan's Binding to control the board, it aims to disrupt and overwhelm opponents quickly. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Gemstone Caverns to power out impactful threats ahead of curve. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game while beating down opponents with efficient creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a strong board presence of efficient creatures like Courser of Kruphix and Knight of the Reliquary, supported by ramp creatures like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Path to Exile, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy. The inclusion of land destruction like Ghost Quarter and Tectonic Edge helps disrupt the opponent's mana base, allowing the aggro strategy to push through for victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Ghost Quarter, Tectonic Edge, and Leonin Arbiter while deploying aggressive creatures like Blade Splicer, Thought-Knot Seer, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to pressure the opponent's life total. The deck also utilizes flicker effects with cards like Flickerwisp and Eldrazi Displacer to gain incremental value and disrupt the opponent's board. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment and Eldrazi Temple provides additional mana acceleration for the powerful Eldrazi creatures in the deck. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and disruption.

The deck's strategy revolves around disrupting opponents' game plans with cards that tax their resources, while also applying early pressure with efficient creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. Through cards like Leonin Arbiter and Ghost Quarter, the deck aims to control the opponent's mana base and prevent them from casting key spells. This Death and Taxes archetype combines aggressive creatures with disruptive elements to punish opponents for trying to execute their game plan, ultimately leading to a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Hollow One, Gurmag Angler, and Flamewake Phoenix. By discarding cards and utilizing the delve ability, the deck is able to cast powerful creatures for reduced mana costs, putting pressure on the opponent early in the game. This aggressive strategy is further supported by cards like Bloodghast and Flameblade Adept, creating a fast and powerful Aggro deck in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with strong Human creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. The key strategy is to use Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, while also benefiting from cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up the team. The deck utilizes a mix of aggression and disruption to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in the early stages of the game.

This deck focuses on maximizing the synergy and efficiency of Human creatures, using cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to grow the team quickly. Additionally, disruption is a key part of the strategy, with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt opponent's game plan. Aether Vial allows for quick deployment of creatures, while cards like Reflector Mage provide tempo advantage. The mana base is set up to support casting a variety of Human creatures efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through cards like Faithless Looting, Young Pyromancer, and Bedlam Reveler. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's hand and board, the deck aims to clear a path for its own threats to deal damage quickly. The inclusion of Blood Moon also provides additional disruption against multicolor decks, giving the Mardu Aggro strategy a strong advantage in the early game.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for powerful late-game plays such as casting big threats like Wurmcoil Engine, World Breaker, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. It also utilizes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the game early on with removal and disruption, then overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats in the late game.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift and Primeval Titan in order to trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Farseek, Search for Tomorrow, and Sakura-Tribe Elder to accelerate mana production and find key pieces of the combo. Lightning Bolt and Sweltering Suns provide removal and board control, while Bloodbraid Elf adds card advantage and pressure. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and win the game through overwhelming burst damage.
